directive.name: ngClick
directive.description: A more powerful replacement for the default ngClick designed to be used on touchscreen devices. Most mobile browsers wait about 300ms after a tap-and-release before sending the click event. This version handles them immediately, and then prevents the following click event from propagating.

directive.name: ngSwipeLeft
directive.description: Specify custom behavior when an element is swiped to the left on a touchscreen device. A leftward swipe is a quick, right-to-left slide of the finger. Though ngSwipeLeft is designed for touch-based devices, it will work with a mouse click and drag too.

directive.name: ngSwipeRight
directive.description: Specify custom behavior when an element is swiped to the right on a touchscreen device. A rightward swipe is a quick, left-to-right slide of the finger. Though ngSwipeRight is designed for touch-based devices, it will work with a mouse click and drag too.
